intro: Scrophularia kotschyi, commonly known as Persian figwort, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. The plant features upright stems that are often hairy, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and are usually pink to purple in color, with five petals and a distinctive tubular structure. Scrophularia kotschyi is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many species with medicinal and ornamental value.
